result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: See terms of Deferred Judgment Agreement
Payment of $100 fine + costs + fees + DNA surcharge = $673.50 less $500 bond on deposit = $173.50 - work out payment with agent.

No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances illegal in WI today without a valid prescription. 
No contact with known drug users or sellers, except in a treatment setting and only with prior agent approval.
No entry into any bars, taverns or businesses whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.

Full compliance with the DJA on Count 1.
Any medications, including those prescribed, may only be taken with prior agent approval.
Must take any medications prescribed for mental health or substance abuse.
AODA and follow through.
Mental health evaluation and follow through.
Completion of all assessments, counseling and follow through as recommended by agent.
DNA sample due 10-17-2022.

records.addlTxt:
1:33 PM Defendant Thaddeus M. Harrison in court.  Attorney Michael Gerald Perry . in court for Thaddeus M. Harrison.  Attorney DeShea D. Morrow in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
DA heard on DJA and provides a copy of the DJA agreement to the court.
Atty Perry provides plea form.
DA heard on agreement.
Atty Perry agrees.
Court arraigns Deft on Count 1.
Deft enters a plea of guilty.
Court arraigns Deft on Count 2.
Deft enters a plea of no contest.
Court arraigns Deft on Count 3.
Deft enters a plea of no contest.
Non-citizen advisory.
Court informs of possible firearm and voting restrictions if found guilty to Count 1.
Deft understands.
PleaQuest/WOR.
Constitutional rights.
Elements of offense.
Atty Perry satisfied.
Factual basis.
Court accepts the DJA.
Court finds Deft enters plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; therefore court accepts the plea but withholds the finding of guilt on Count 1, subject to the terms of the DJA.
Court finds Deft enters plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; therefore court accepts the pleas and finds Deft guilty to Counts 2 and 3.
DA heard on sentencing.
Atty Perry heard on sentencing.
Deft heard.
Court heard on factors.

Court withholds the sentencing on Counts 2 and 3 and places Deft on probation for 2 years.
Conditions of probation on Count 2:
Full compliance with the DJA on Count 1.
Payment of $100 fine + costs + fees + DNA surcharge = $673.50 - $500 bond on deposit to be applied to fees due and remaining balance to be worked out with agent.
No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances illegal in WI today, without a valid prescription.
Any medications, including those prescribed, may only be taken with prior agent approval.
Must take any medications prescribed for mental health or substance abuse.
AODA and follow through.
Mental health evaluation and follow through.
No contact with known drug users or sellers, except in a treatment setting, and only with prior agent approval.
No entry into any bars, taverns, or businesses whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
Completion of all assessments, counseling and follow through as recommended by agent.
DNA sample due 10-17-2022.
Conditions of probation on Count 3:
Full compliance with the DJA on Count 1.
30 days conditional jail with good time and huber release.
Credit for 9 days time served.
Deft to report to the Marinette County Jail no later than 7pm on November 15, 2022.
Payment of DNA surcharge only = $200 - payment to be worked out with agent.
No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances illegal in WI today, without a valid prescription.
Any medications, including those prescribed, may only be taken with prior agent approval.
Must take any medications prescribed for mental health or substance abuse.
AODA and follow through.
Mental health evaluation and follow through.
No contact with known drug users or sellers, except in a treatment setting, and only with prior agent approval.
No entry into any bars, taverns, or businesses whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
Completion of all assessments, counseling and follow through as recommended by agent.
DNA sample due 10-17-2022.
Appeal rights.
1:59 PM

2:59 PM Prosecuting attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Thaddeus M. Harrison in court.  Attorney Michael Gerald Perry . in court for Thaddeus M. Harrison. 
Copy of info.
Atty Perry - tracks comp, waives reading, enters n/g plea, request JT and STC be scheduled.
Court schedules STC w/parties.
3:02 pm
Status conference scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

3:09 PM Prosecuting attorney DeShea D. Morrow in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Thaddeus M. Harrison in court.  Attorney Michael Gerald Perry . in court for Thaddeus M. Harrison. 
Atty Perry - waiver today, provided form.
Atty Perry - reviewed w/client, satisfied, waiver based on offer of State.
Court reviews form w/Deft.
Deft waives prelim.
Court finds Deft freely waives prelim and binds over for trial.
Court schedules w/parties.
3:13 pm
Arraignment scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

9:12 AM Defendant Thaddeus M. Harrison in court.  Attorney Michael Gerald Perry . in court for Thaddeus M. Harrison.  Attorney DeShea D. Morrow in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
Copy of complaint.
Atty Perry heard - has reviewed with deft.
Deft understands.
Waives formal readings.
Requests prelim and waives time limits.
Court schedules.
9:13 AM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

2:07 PM Prosecuting attorney DeShea D. Morrow in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Thaddeus M. Harrison appeared by video, in custody. 
Court calls case.
Copy of complaint.
Court reviews charges and max penalties.
Deft understands.
DA heard on bond recommendation.
Deft heard.
Court imposes $500 cash bail w/ conditions; sign waiver of extradition, no possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances w/o a valid RX, no contact with K.K. or  A.C.
Court schedules with parties.
Deft to contact the Public Defender's office today.
2:09 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
